Thanks for the update -- I'm sure others will hit this too so it's good 
to have a solution in the list archives.

FYI, through Java 1.6, I highly recommend the Sun JVM rather than 
OpenJDK. (The 1.6 OpenJDK distribution has a bit of an odd pedigree, 
backported from a 7 prerelease, and my understanding is that it doesn't 
get the same test coverage and bug attention as the latest Sun 1.6 JVM 
releases. We've historically seen some oddities that clear up when 
moving away from OpenJDK.)

If choosing to run on a Java7 preview release, apparently the Sun and 
OpenJDK versions are in much closer sync. (We haven't yet tested on 
Java7, so there may be other issues, but there's less reason to believe 
they'd be different for OpenJDK.)

- Gordon @ IA

On 9/26/10 8:53 AM, raffaele messuti wrote:
>
> On Sep 26, 2010, at 4:47 PM, Gordon Mohr wrote:
>> ...suggest there may be something wrong with the address you've requested the UI bind its socket to. What are you passing as the argument to the '-b' flag, if anything?
>
> i solved, seems a debian packaging issue
> http://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=573742
> (not only openjdk, also sun-jre is affected)
>
> i've modified JAVACMD in bin/heritrix
> and added -Djava.net.preferIPv4Stack=true
>
> ciao
>
>
>

> raffaele@...
